==Events==
*[[1066]] &ndash; [[Edgar the Ætheling]] proclaimed King of England, but never crowned. Reigned until 10 December 1066.
*[[1211]] &ndash; [[Battle of the Rhyndacus (1211)|Battle of the Rhyndacus]]: The [[Latin emperor]] [[Henry of Flanders]] defeats the [[Nicaean emperor]] [[Theodore I Lascaris]].
*[[1529]] &ndash; The [[Siege of Vienna]] ends as the Austrians rout the invading Turks, turning the tide against almost a century of unchecked conquest throughout eastern and central Europe by the [[Ottoman Empire]].
*[[1582]] &ndash; [[Pope Gregory XIII]] implements the [[Gregorian calendar]]. In Italy, Poland, Portugal, and Spain, [[October 4]] of this year is followed directly by October 15.
*[[1764]] &ndash; [[Edward Gibbon]] observes a group of friars singing in the ruined [[Temple of Jupiter (Capitoline Hill)|Temple of Jupiter]] in Rome, which inspires him to begin work on ''[[The History of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire]]''.
*[[1783]] &ndash; The [[Montgolfier brothers]]' [[hot air balloon]] marks the first human ascent, by [[Jean-François Pilâtre de Rozier]], (tethered balloon).
*[[1793]] &ndash; Queen [[Marie-Antoinette]] of France is tried and convicted in a swift, pre-determined trial in the Palais de Justice, Paris, and condemned to death the following day.
*[[1815]] &ndash; [[Napoleon I of France]] begins his exile on [[Saint Helena]] in the Atlantic Ocean.
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The [[CSS Hunley|''H. L. Hunley'']], the first [[submarine]] to sink a ship, sinks during a test, killing its inventor, [[Horace Lawson Hunley|Horace L. Hunley]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; American Civil War:  The [[Battle of Glasgow]] is fought, resulting in the surrender of [[Glasgow, Missouri]], and its Union garrison, to the [[Confederate States of America|Confederacy]].
*[[1878]] &ndash; The [[Edison Electric Light Company]] begins operation.
*[[1880]] &ndash; Mexican soldiers kill [[Victorio]], one of the greatest [[Apache Tribe|Apache]] military strategists.
*[[1888]] &ndash; The [[From Hell letter|"From Hell" letter]] sent by [[Jack the Ripper]] is received by investigators.
*[[1894]] &ndash; The [[Dreyfus affair]]: [[Alfred Dreyfus]] is arrested for spying.
*[[1904]] &ndash; The Russian [[Baltic Fleet]] leaves [[Reval]], [[Estonia]] for [[Lüshunkou|Port Arthur]] during the [[Russo-Japanese War]].
*[[1910]] &ndash; [[America (airship)|Airship America]] launched from New Jersey in the first attempt to cross the Atlantic by a powered aircraft.
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: At [[Vincennes]] outside of Paris, [[Netherlands|Dutch]] dancer [[Mata Hari]] is executed by [[firing squad]] for [[espionage|spying]] for the [[German Empire]].
*[[1928]] &ndash; The airship, ''[[LZ 127 Graf Zeppelin|Graf Zeppelin]]'' completes its first trans-Atlantic flight, landing at [[Lakehurst, New Jersey]], United States.
*[[1932]] &ndash; Tata Airlines (later to become [[Air India]]) makes its first flight.
*[[1934]] &ndash; The [[Jiangxi Soviet|Soviet Republic of China]] collapses when [[Chiang Kai-shek]]'s [[National Revolutionary Army]] successfully encircles [[Ruijin]], forcing the fleeing [[Communist Party of China|Communists]] to begin the [[Long March]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; The New York Municipal Airport (later renamed [[LaGuardia Airport]]) is dedicated.
*[[1940]] &ndash; The President of Catalonia, [[Lluís Companys]], is executed by the Spanish dictatorship of Francisco Franco, making him the only European president to have been executed.
*[[1944]] &ndash; The [[Arrow Cross Party]] (very similar to [[Adolf Hitler|Hitler's]] NSDAP (Nazi party)) takes power in Hungary.
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The former premier of [[Vichy France]] [[Pierre Laval]] is shot by a [[firing squad]] for [[treason]].
*[[1951]] &ndash; Mexican chemist [[Luis E. Miramontes]] conducts the very last step of the first synthesis of [[norethisterone]], the [[progestin]] that would later be used in one of the first three [[combined oral contraceptive pill|oral contraceptive]]s.
*  1951   &ndash; The first episode of ''[[I Love Lucy]]'', an American television [[sitcom]] starring [[Lucille Ball]], [[Desi Arnaz]], [[Vivian Vance]], and [[William Frawley]], airs on the Columbia Broadcasting System (CBS).
*[[1953]] &ndash; British [[nuclear test]] ''Totem 1'' detonated at [[Emu Field]], [[South Australia]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[Hurricane Hazel]] devastates the eastern seaboard, killing 95 and causing massive floods as far north as Toronto.  As a [[Saffir-Simpson Scale|Category 4]] upon landfall, it is the strongest storm on record to strike as far north as [[North Carolina]].
*[[1956]] &ndash; [[Fortran]], the first modern computer language, is shared with the coding community for the first time.
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: The [[Catholic Worker Movement]] stages an anti-war rally in Manhattan including a public [[Draft-card burning|burning of a draft card]]; the first such act to result in arrest under a new amendment to the Selective Service Act.
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[Black Panther Party]] is created by [[Huey P. Newton]] and [[Bobby Seale]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; Vietnam War; The [[Moratorium to End the War in Vietnam]] is held in Washington DC and across the US. Over 2 million demonstrate nationally; about 250,000 in the nation's capital.
*[[1970]] &ndash; Thirty-five construction workers are killed when a section of the new [[West Gate Bridge]] in [[Melbourne]] collapses.
*  1970   &ndash; The domestic [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[Aeroflot Flight 244]] is hijacked and diverted to [[Turkey]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; The start of the 2500-year celebration of [[Iran]], celebrating the birth of [[Persia]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Black Monday (Malta)|Black Monday]] in [[Malta]]. The Building of the Times of Malta, the residence of the opposition leader [[Eddie Fenech Adami]] and several [[Nationalist Party (Malta)|Nationalist Party]] clubs are ransacked and destroyed by supporters of the [[Malta Labour Party]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; The [[Great Storm of 1987]] hits France and England.
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Wayne Gretzky]] becomes the all-time leading points scorer in the [[NHL]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; Soviet Union leader [[Mikhail Gorbachev]] is awarded the [[Nobel Peace Prize]] for his efforts to lessen [[Cold War]] tensions and open up his nation.
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Marco Campos]], died in an accident in a [[International Formula 3000]] race at the [[Circuit de Nevers Magny-Cours]] circuit, making him the only driver ever killed in the International Formula 3000 series.
*[[1997]] &ndash; The first supersonic [[land speed record]] is set by [[Andy Green]] in ''[[ThrustSSC]]'' (United Kingdom), exactly 50 years and 1 day after [[Chuck Yeager]] first broke the [[sound barrier]] in the Earth's atmosphere.
*  1997   &ndash; The [[Cassini-Huygens Mission|Cassini probe]] launches from [[Cape Canaveral]] on its way to [[Saturn]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[NASA]]'s [[Galileo spacecraft]] passes within 112 miles of [[Jupiter]]'s moon [[Io (moon)|Io]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; China launches [[Shenzhou 5]], its first [[manned space mission]].
*  2003   &ndash; The [[Staten Island Ferry]] boat ''[[Andrew J. Barberi]]'' [[2003 Staten Island Ferry crash|runs into]] a pier at the [[St. George Ferry Terminal]] in [[Staten Island]], killing 11 people and injuring 43.
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[2005 Toledo Riot|A riot]] in [[Toledo, Ohio]] breaks out during a [[Neo-Nazi|National Socialist/Neo-Nazi]] protest; over 100 are arrested.
*[[2007]] &ndash; Seventeen activists in New Zealand are arrested in the country's first post 9/11 [[2007 New Zealand anti-terror raids|anti-terrorism raids]].
*[[2008]] &ndash; The [[Dow Jones Industrial Average]] closed down 733.08 points, or 7.87%, the second [[Black Monday (1987)|worst day in the Dow's history]] based on a percentage drop.
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[15 October 2011 global protests|Global protests]] break out in 120 cities in 48 countries.
*[[2012]] &ndash; British Prime Minister [[David Cameron]] and Scottish First Minister [[Alex Salmond]] agree on a [[Edinburgh Agreement (2012)|deal]] setting out the terms of a [[Scottish independence referendum, 2014|referendum on Scottish independence]] at a meeting in [[Edinburgh]]. 
*[[2013]] &ndash; A 7.2-[[Surface wave magnitude|magnitude]] [[2013 Bohol earthquake|earthquake strikes]] the [[Philippines]], resulting in more than 215 deaths.
